data.title: VSCode opened from Command prompt closes if cmd closed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open command prompt in a folder and use command 'code .'
2. after vscode launches close the cmd , it will also close the corresponding vscode window.

I would be great if this wasn't the case.

data.title: Fix #14135 - Allow files with merge status to be staged
data.body:
Allows files with merge status to be staged using `workbench.action.git.stage`.
Fixes #14135.

data.title: Internal terminal isn't correctly wrapped bash terminal
data.body:
I cannot overwrite in settings "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "%COMSPEC%"
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11016041/19879272/cadc1a12-a012-11e6-8387-90099482c450.png)
For `"terminal.external.windowsExec": "%CURRENT_DIR%git-for-windows\\bin\\bash.exe"`
I can

This is not help #7286, but it's dublicate: #7344 (it's not resolve)

But It's work: `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "D:\\git-for-windows\\bin\\bash.exe"`
Full path is working!
`SET CURRENT_DIR=%~dp0`

Found solution:
` SET COMSPEC=%CURRENT_DIR%git-for-windows\bin\bash.exe`
and after that run VSCODE

But I cannot run terminal.external.windowsExec

And I have problem with bash, there are extra characters, the console behaves is abnormally. When I run bash outside, all is correct.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11016041/19881447/9330ef7e-a027-11e6-9349-7800f35f472c.png)

data.title: Running cmd.exe in minimize mode
data.body:
How pass to "terminal.external.windowsExec": "%COMSPEC%"
parameters or another way run cmd in minimize mode.
For example, I want:
start /min cmd.exe

How to supress “Terminate batch job (Y/N)” confirmation?

I found solution, create bat file, in body:
start /min %COMSPEC%

"terminal.external.windowsExec": "%PATH_TO_BAT%"

%PATH_TO_BAT% - set in bat, where we run VSCODE.

Is there another way?

data.title: How get environment variable in settings
data.body:
1. Latest
2. Windows 10

I want use environment varible, the same %COMSPEC%

This code isn't work:
`"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "%~dp0git-for-windows\\bin\\bash.exe"`

I try create in .bat file environment variable and run VSCODE, but it's not work too.

data.title: Breakpoints on particular column
data.body:
There might be an issue for this already but I can't find one, so here's a general feature request for discussion.

It would be very useful to be able to set a breakpoint on a particular column of a line. It's useful for debugging promises - 

```javascript
asyncFn().then(() => foo())
    .then(() => bar())
    .then(() => something())
```

or minified code -
```javascript
a();b();c();
```

especially since we don't have any way to pretty-print scripts while debugging them. As is, there's no way to break inside the `then`s or on expressions that are packed on the same line without reformatting your code or setting breakpoints in other places.

This is handled by the protocol already but needs UI work.
- How do we show which part of the line the breakpoint is associated with?
    - VS and F12 highlight the actual statement for the bp. I'm not sure that works for vscode, because we'll only know the column position and won't necessarily have the language knowledge to know the whole span in question. 
    - Show a decoration inline if column != 0? Only visible when hovering over the bp in the margin?
    - Then these will often show up when setting a bp with F9, just because the cursor is somewhere else in the line, even if it's the same as a bp at column 0
- How do we show multiple breakpoints on one line?
- Need a 'add breakpoint' as a context menu option on the editor
- Setting a breakpoint by F9 needs to respect the column position of the cursor

And a cheaper way to experiment with this could be to change the "Run to cursor" option to respect the column.

data.title: No editor action to jump to next error in project
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1

The editor action `editor.action.marker.next` ("Go to Next Error or Warning") only works for the current file. There seems to be no editor action for finding the next error in the project, even when the errors panel shows multiple files.

1. Run a PowerShell script that removes files inside the opened folder
2. Run Refresh/press Refresh button in the Explorer

Result: files are still shown in the Explorer while they don't exist any more.

data.title: Fix #14729 - Don't escape newlines in console eval results. They are still escaped elsewhere.
data.body:
One possibility... my comment on the issue

> at first I wanted to skip massageValue for eval results in the console, but it seems like strings in an object preview like ["a\nb"] should stay on one line. We could leave the logic up to the debug adapter like you say, but other debugger authors are assuming that their strings will be escaped for them. Is that too big of a breaking change?

Also, we could do massageValue only when an object is returned, i.e. when the eval result has a variablesReference, so that object previews with newlines will remain escaped, but that seems too inconsistent.

data.title: No workbench action to hide panel
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1

There's no editor action to hide the panel. There is only `workbench.action.togglePanel`, and there's apparently no context so you can do `when: "panelVisible"` or whatever. So there's no way to bind a key to something that hides the panel.

data.title: Register or Notify on Extension
data.body: Not sure if this is available through the recommended extenstion.json but would like to have an option to set specific words, that upon opening VS or the Extension pane / choosing from menu will show me all the new extensions that contain my specified words that have been added since last opened or seen.

data.title: editor.action.jumpToBracket does not match in plaintext scope
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1

Steps to Reproduce:

Consider a plaintext file:

```
text (with parantheses).
```

If you navigate to one of the parantheses, `editor.action.jumpToBracket` does not work. Brackets are completely ignored there.

Similarly, here's a YAML file with a string:

```yaml
foo: "text (with parantheses)."
```

Same behaviour.

Is this because there's no grammar associated with the text block? If so, why? This works fine in Atom, where brackets seem to match irrespective of grammar. Bracket matching is useful no matter if the editor knows what the content is.

1. Have settings in settings.json for User settings before updating VSCode to 17.0-insider
2. Upgrade to 17.0
3. All existing user settings in settings.json disappears and it is overrides by some properties from VSCode itself.

Some existing feature in Extensions are broken badly with this change.

data.title: Move tab with keyboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: OSX Sierra

It would be great if you could move tabs with the keyboard. Something like this Sublimetext plugin https://github.com/SublimeText/MoveTab

This makes it so pressing shift and command + arrow would move the tab left or right. You could also configure it so you can move a tab to the first position with one binding.

data.title: Integrated terminal access through extension?
data.body:
Hi,

Is there any way to access the content shown in integrated terminal through an extension? I'm interested in formatting error messages o even explore the possibility of extending it so I can click on a stack trace and go to the line.

data.title: Cmd+D selects too broadly in some grammars
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: 10.12.1

In some grammars such as JSON, cmd+D matches a lot more than in other grammars. In most grammars, cmd+D seems to use word-matching semantics. In most grammars, if your caret is here:

```go
"hello world<caret>"
```

and you hit cmd+D, then `world` is selected. In JSON files, the entire `"hello world"` is selected. That's inconsistent and weird. I don't know what other grammars are affected.

Behaviour is same irrespective of whether "whole word" match semantics are enabled.

data.title: The terminal clear command should delete the entire buffer, not hide it
Error when I open integrated terminal (on Mac)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: MacOS El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Integrated Terminal
2. See error displayed at the top

I have 2 MacBooks with VSCode installed. One works fine and the other has this error. I have ready other issues related to the integrated terminal not working related to folders with spaces or special characters but that is not the case here. There is no folder in the path which is unusual.

How can I get more information about the error? I opened the Console and did not see anything logged there after attempting to open the integrated terminal. I'd like to figure out why this is happening so I can fix it and start using there terminal within VSCode.

data.title: Question: How to silent install with "Open with Code" enabled?
data.body:
Hello,

I can install VSCode silently with: VSCode.exe /verysilent
How do I make it turn on the options for "Open with Code" in the context menu when I install that way?

Thanks!

data.title: Extra quotes inserted when typed during cmd-D selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file with a _non-plaintext_ syntax, such as Python.
2. Populate the file with: `'a', 'b', 'c'`
3. Select a single quote and hit cmd-D 5 times (to select all).
4. Hit backspace to delete quote.
5. Type a single quote (or a double quote; same bug).
6. Result will be: `'a', 'b', 'c''` (note last extract quote)

Also note that if you select across multiple lines, the extra quote is inserted on each line:

```
'a', 'b', 'c''
'a', 'b', 'c''
```

data.title: Cmd+D has no "select all occurrences" counterpart
data.body:
Cmd+D currently seems to require that you hit it as many times as there are occurrences, in order to match all occurrences of the selection. Atom has shift+cmd+D, which instantly (as far as anything in Atom is instant) selects all occurrences. This is extremely useful.

(It's unfortunate that VSCode has already used shift+cmd+D for "go to debugger pane". It's not a great idea to abuse shift like this when there's already a corresponding shift-less shortcut — shift's behaviour is usually to modify another shortcut. Wouldn't the function keys F1, F2 etc. be better for switching between the "big task" panes?)

data.title: VSCode not functioning behind proxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. F1->ext install


The only way to have this functioning is
1. Open User Settings 
2. Write in settings.json
```
{
    "http.proxy": "http://172.16.1.1:8080/"
}
```

Take care of use "http://". 
` require('url').parse('172.16.1.1:8080') `highlighted the error in parsing host and hostname.

I found this thanks to @joaomoreno at this [link](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/69#issuecomment-185199160)

data.title: Fat extension descriptions
data.body: We have an [`ExtensionDescription`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/extensions/common/extensions.ts#L12) which is basically a subset of an extension's `package.json`. However, when [parsing](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/node/extensionPoints.ts#L87) and worst send setting up the extension host we use *everything* that's in the file. That can be a lot more data then we want and might affect start up performance because we need everything to be send over to the extension host

data.title: Error and warnings gets overrided by dependencies projects
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:43:46.054Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-45-generic
- Extensions: christian-kohler.path-intellisense-1.1.0, ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1, qinjia.seti-icons-0.1.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Create 2 projects, write basic code in each, reference project 1 in project 2
2.Make unecessary using in project 1
3. Type an error in project 2, project 2 shows error for a brief moment, then just shows warning of project 1

Very annoying
